title: RAK7271/RAK7371 WisGate Developer Base Datasheet > RAK7271/RAK7371 WisGate Developer Base Datasheet > Overview > Description > RAK Developer Base Overview and Integration
content: The RAK Developer Base is a device designed for integration with desktop, mobile, or embedded systems. It enables the RAK2287 or RAK5146 mPCIe LoRa concentrator modules to function as USB Type-C pluggable devices, utilizing the included Type-C to Type-A cable.
parent_content:
The RAK Developer Base is a device designed for integration with desktop, mobile, or embedded systems. It enables the RAK2287 or RAK5146 mPCIe LoRa concentrator modules to function as USB Type-C pluggable devices, utilizing the included Type-C to Type-A cable.  
This new approach enables easy integration into existing hardware, such as routers and industrial PCs, adding LoRaWAN gateway capabilities. For example, it can transform a laptop into a testbed LoRaWAN gateway by simply plugging it in and running the appropriate software stack.  
Equipped with fully functional concentrator modules, it supports 8 uplink channels and 1 downlink channel at SF7–12 (RAK2287) or SF5–12 (RAK5146).  
The RAK Developer Base is an ideal solution for LPWAN deployments where integration with existing hardware is crucial, or scenarios when on the go deployment is required, for drive testing or coverage evaluation in mobile scenarios.  
This device provides a complete and cost-efficient LoRa gateway solution, offering up to 10 programmable parallel demodulation paths.

title: RAK7271/RAK7371 WisGate Developer Base Datasheet > RAK7271/RAK7371 WisGate Developer Base Datasheet > Overview > Package Contents > Package Contents [TABLE]
content:
- 1pc RAK Developer Base
- 1pc USB Type C to A Cable
- 1pc LoRa Antenna (2.3 dBi)  
> **Image:** Package Contents
parent_content:
- 1pc RAK Developer Base
- 1pc USB Type C to A Cable
- 1pc LoRa Antenna (2.3 dBi)  
> **Image:** Package Contents

title: RAK7271/RAK7371 WisGate Developer Base Datasheet > RAK7271/RAK7371 WisGate Developer Base Datasheet > Specifications > Overview > Components of RAK7271/RAK7371 WisGate Developer Base
content:
The RAK7271/RAK7371 WisGate Developer Base consists of four components:  
1. RAK2005
2. RAK2287/RAK5146
3. iPEX to RP-SMA female cable
4. Casing
parent_content:
The RAK7271/RAK7371 WisGate Developer Base consists of four components:  
1. RAK2005
2. RAK2287/RAK5146
3. iPEX to RP-SMA female cable
4. Casing

title: RAK7271/RAK7371 WisGate Developer Base Datasheet > RAK7271/RAK7371 WisGate Developer Base Datasheet > Specifications > Hardware > Interfaces > WisGate Developer Base Interfaces Overview
content:
> **Image:** WisGate Developer Base Interfaces  
- **Power supply**: There is a 5V to 3.3V DC-DC converter integrated on RAK2005, so the 5V DC that comes from the USB interface is enough for this device.
parent_content:
> **Image:** WisGate Developer Base Interfaces  
- **Power supply**: There is a 5V to 3.3V DC-DC converter integrated on RAK2005, so the 5V DC that comes from the USB interface is enough for this device.
- **USB Interface**: This device can connect to any USB 2.0 host equipped with compatible drivers. The RAK2287/RAK5146 module inside supports high-speed USB-to-SPI conversion via the STM32L412KBU6. It features a USB 2.0 compliant interface with a maximum data rate of 480Mb/s, serving as the communication interface with an external host application processor.
- **RP-SMA antenna interface**: The modules feature a single RF interface via a standard RPSMA connector with a characteristic impedance of 50Ω. This RF port supports both transmission (Tx) and reception (Rx), serving as the antenna interface.

title: RAK7271/RAK7371 WisGate Developer Base Datasheet > RAK7271/RAK7371 WisGate Developer Base Datasheet > Specifications > Hardware > RF Characteristics > Operating Frequencies > Supported LoRaWAN Bands by Region [TABLE]
content:
The WisGate Developer Base supports the LoRaWAN bands in the table below.  
| **Region**    | **Frequency (MHz)** |
| ------------- | ------------------- |
| China         | CN470               |
| Russia        | RU864               |
| India         | IN865               |
| Europe        | EU433, EU868        |
| North America | US915               |
| Australia     | AU915               |
| Korea         | KR920               |
| Asia          | AS923               |
parent_content:
The WisGate Developer Base supports the LoRaWAN bands in the table below.  
| **Region**    | **Frequency (MHz)** |
| ------------- | ------------------- |
| China         | CN470               |
| Russia        | RU864               |
| India         | IN865               |
| Europe        | EU433, EU868        |
| North America | US915               |
| Australia     | AU915               |
| Korea         | KR920               |
| Asia          | AS923               |

title: RAK7271/RAK7371 WisGate Developer Base Datasheet > RAK7271/RAK7371 WisGate Developer Base Datasheet > Specifications > Hardware > RF Characteristics > LoRa RF Characteristics > Optimized RSSI Calibration Values and Sensitivity Levels [TABLE]
content:
It is highly recommended to use optimized RSSI calibration values, which is part of the HAL v3.1. For both, Radio 1 and 2, the RSSI-Offset should be set -169.0. The following table gives the typical sensitivity level of the RAK2287 and RAK5146.  
| Signal Bandwidth (kHz) | Spreading Factor | Sensitivity (dBm) |
| :--------------------: | :--------------: | :---------------: |
|          125           |        12        |       -139        |
parent_content:

| Signal Bandwidth (kHz) | Spreading Factor | Sensitivity (dBm) |
| :--------------------: | :--------------: | :---------------: |
|          125           |        12        |       -139        |
|          125           |        7         |       -125        |
|          250           |        12        |       -136        |
|          250           |        7         |       -123        |
|          500           |        12        |       -134        |
|          500           |        7         |       -120        |
